title: U.S. Millennials : most popular social network 2016 , by age group
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Platforms for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34 that are presented on the X-axis.
Platform Facebook had the maximum Share of respondents among all 3 groups, and it was for 30-34. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Platform Twitter for 25-29.
Among all the Platforms, 25-29 had the highest Share of respondents in Platform Facebook and lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
Platform Facebook and Twitter had the biggest gap of 40.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 25-29.

max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Platforms for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34 that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 3 groups, 30-34 had the highest Share of respondents in Platform Facebook and 25-29 had the lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
Among all the Platforms, 25-29 had the highest Share of respondents 41.0 in Platform Facebook and lowest value 1.0 in Platform Twitter.
There is a gap of 40.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 25-29 in Platform Facebook and Twitter.
Out of all 3 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents was found in case of 25-29.
30-34 had the maximum Share of respondents out of all 3 groups in Platform Facebook followed by 30-34 in Facebook, and the minimum Share of respondents is found for 25-29 in Twitter.
Averaging all 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34, the Platform Facebook is the maximum Share of respondents and Twitter is the minimum Share of respondents.
